bioghist.p: Father Francis Driscoll (1899-1945) was born on Staten Island, New York. He entered the novitiate at Villanova, Pennsylvania, in 1905 and was ordained to the priesthood 1912. After ordination Father Driscoll was assigned to Villanova College as a professor of mathematics. In 1914 he was appointed vice president of the College and served as president from 1920 until 1924. In 1925 he founded Cascia Hall, a new Augustinian preparatory school in Tulsa, Oklahoma.

scopecontent.p: This is a small collection of papers of Father Francis A. Driscoll. Materials include correspondence, legal records, and a program. The correspondence deals with academic accreditation of the pre-medical program. The legal documents consist of excerpts from the deed of the Malvern Preparatory School. The program is a farewell tendered to Rev. Francis A. Driscoll, O.S.A., LL.D. The program booklet includes a picture of Father Driscoll.
